org.gridgain.grid.spi.swapspace.file
Class GridFileSwapSpaceSpi

java.lang.Object
  org.gridgain.grid.spi.GridSpiAdapter
      org.gridgain.grid.spi.swapspace.file.GridFileSwapSpaceSpi
All Implemented Interfaces:
GridSpi, GridSpiJsonConfigurable, GridSpiManagementMBean, GridFileSwapSpaceSpiMBean, GridSwapSpaceSpi
@GridSpiInfo(author="GridGain Systems, Inc.",
             url="www.gridgain.com",
             email="support@gridgain.com",
             version="3.5.0c.22082011")
@GridSpiMultipleInstancesSupport(value=true)
public class GridFileSwapSpaceSpi
extends GridSpiAdapter
implements GridSwapSpaceSpi, GridFileSwapSpaceSpiMBean

File-based implementation of swap space SPI.

Key-value pairs are stored by this implementation in separate files with names generated using provided space name and key. The format of the file are the following:

[value length (integer) bytes][value bytes]

where value length bytes describes number of bytes containing in value bytes respectively. Length of this field is calculated as Integer.SIZE >> 2 that reflects number of bytes in integer value for current JVM.

Wiki & Forum:

Field Detail

DFLT_BASE_DIRECTORY_PATH

public static final String DFLT_BASE_DIRECTORY_PATH
Default checkpoint directory (value is work/swapspace/file). Note that this path used relatively GRIDGAIN_HOME directory when GRIDGAIN_HOME exists. For unknown GRIDGAIN_HOME another directory GridFileSwapSpaceSpi.DFLT_TMP_DIRECTORY is used.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DFLT_TMP_DIRECTORY

public static final String DFLT_TMP_DIRECTORY
Default directory name for SPI when GRIDGAIN_HOME not defined. This directory name relative to file path in java.io.tmpdir system property value (value is gg.file.swapspace).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DFLT_MAX_SWAP_SIZE

public static final long DFLT_MAX_SWAP_SIZE
Default maximum size in bytes for all swap spaces (value is -1) means unlimited size.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DFLT_MAX_SWAP_CNT

public static final int DFLT_MAX_SWAP_CNT
Default maximum swap space names count (value is -1) means unlimited count.

See Also:

Specified by:

setDirectoryPath

@GridSpiConfiguration(optional=true)
public void setDirectoryPath(String dirPath)
Sets path to a directory where swap space values will be stored. The path can either be absolute or relative to GRIDGAIN_HOME system or environment variable.

If not provided, default value is GridFileSwapSpaceSpi.DFLT_BASE_DIRECTORY_PATH.

Parameters:
dirPath - Absolute or GridGain installation home folder relative path where swap space values will be stored.

isPersistent

public boolean isPersistent()
Data will not be removed from disk if this property is true.

Specified by:
isPersistent in interface GridFileSwapSpaceSpiMBean
Returns:
true if data must not be deleted at SPI stop, false otherwise.

setPersistent

@GridSpiConfiguration(optional=true)
public void setPersistent(boolean persist)
Data will not be removed from disk if this property is true.

Note that if this property is set to false then swap file names are formed using local node id to isolate different executions of the same GridGain installation from each other in order to avoid concurrent access problems.

But if this property is true then file names are free of local node id because the node id is different for every next execution and there should be a possibility to parse file names at startup to restore previously stored swap entries. So, in this case, executing more than one grid with the same name is not safe since started grids will share the same directory and the same files.

Parameters:
persist - true if data must not be deleted at SPI stop, otherwise false.

isDeleteCorrupted

public boolean isDeleteCorrupted()
If this property is true then spi will check for corrupted files at SPI start and delete them.

Specified by:

spiStart

public void spiStart(String gridName)
              throws GridSpiException
This method is called to start SPI. After this method returns successfully kernel assumes that SPI is fully operational.

Specified by:
spiStart in interface GridSpi
Throws:
GridSpiException - Throws in case of any error during SPI start.
Parameters:
gridName - Name of grid instance this SPI is being started for (null for default grid).

spiStop

public void spiStop()
             throws GridSpiException
This method is called to stop SPI. After this method returns kernel assumes that this SPI is finished and all resources acquired by it are released.

Note that this method can be called at any point including during recovery of failed start. It should make no assumptions on what state SPI will be in when this method is called.

Specified by:
spiStop in interface GridSpi
Throws:
GridSpiException - Thrown in case of any error during SPI stop.
